intro: Ormosia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ormosia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of India, Indonesia, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with narrow, elongated leaflets and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Ormosia cuneata typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
